text: date: tue, 23 nov 1999 02:43:16 +0200 from: "vesa metsthti" (vesa@medusa.fi)to: newsfeedback@wired.comsubject: park those meter worrieswith regard to "park those meter worries," 22.nov.1999, asimilar in-car smart-card paying device has been in use in helsinki finland for at least from 1996.money can be loaded into cards in kiosks, service stations, and money machines. instead of reading through a handhelddevice, they all have a lcd screen displaying needed information.for some reason this has not been a big hit in helsinki – people are not willing to pay 499mk (us$90) for a device theyuse to pay their parking (even though they get 20 percent discount). most devices seen are bought by companies for theiremployees since a smart card is [an] easy way for them to pay for employers parking....
